results.title: The USA in world trade: round trip
results.creator_credit: Roger Barlow, Raymond Spottiswoode and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Documents the importance and extent of world trade, emphasising its significance to the United States. An American auto worker, a southern farmer, a house-wife, a British machinist, a French labourer, and a Mexican farmer give their views on world trade. Dr Riefler, an economist, uses animated models to show the effects of tariffs, and reveals how nations are planning to bring about satisfactory trade arrangements.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Barlow, Raymond Spottiswoode and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Unseen enemy
results.creator_credit: Damian Brown, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Safe, basic food handling methods are necessary to prevent contamination by bacteria. This film shows how unhygienic handling of cooked meats results in food poisoning.

results.title: The Unreal image
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Pair of Eyes”.
Drawing on his knowledge of the Middle East to illustrate his theme, with part of the film shot in Britain and Greece also, David Holden, journalist and former Times Middle East correspondent, presents the argument that modern communications increase the fragmentation of the world by bombarding the individual with stultifying stereotyped images.

results.title: The Unquiet land - civil war in England 1642-1646
results.brief_description: A detailed account of the Civil War of England in 1642-1646. Includes the division of the country prior to the Civil War through to the entrance of the Scots, the battle of Marston Moor and the final surrender of the King’s forces in 1646.

results.title: The Unplanned
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Bill Brind and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
An industrial accident-prevention film illustrating that an accident usually has several causes. A situation is portrayed in a large machine shop, where a series of unsafe acts, combined with unsafe conditions, led to an accident in which a man’s arm was caught in an unguarded machine. A film to stimulate discussion among managers, supervisors and safety professionals, as well as for all industrial employees.
(Awards: Belgrade; Poznan.)

results.title: The Unorganised manager. Part II. Salvation (NP)
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of time management and delegation practices. “Salvation” shows Richard Lewis, a harassed, overworked and over stressed manager, guided by St Peter towards a more productive managerial mode by learning to delegate effectively. Cast includes John Cleese, James Bolan. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: The Unlucky ones
results.brief_description: The film promotes the use of fire-resistant materials in the manufacture and purchase of children’s clothing and especially nightwear in the interests of child safety. Shot at the Royal Children’s Hospital, Melbourne, it shows children being brought in by ambulance and their treatment for burns and scalds, including skin grafting; also interviews by the surgeons with the parents about their children’s accidents. Co-produced with the Australian Wool Corporation and the Royal Children’s Hospital, Melbourne.

results.title: The Unknown land
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Scenes and songs of Australia’s northwest; the Pilbara and Kimberley areas, prospecting (old and new) and mining, pearling at Broome, the Ord River dam, and the cattle industry.

results.title: The University years
results.creator_credit: Raymond Hancock and South Africa. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Illustrates the complexity of higher educational organisations and at the same time the wide range of facilities offered in a multi-national country such as South Africa. We see Rand, Port Elizabeth and Rhodes Universities: teaching situations, the study of electricity, teaching deaf children and veterinary studies.
